title: How to Do the Orange Justice Dance: A Quick & Easy Tutorial

steps.title: Start with your feet apart and sway your legs to the right.
steps.content: Start with your feet apart and sway your legs to the right. Stand with your feet shoulder width apart and bend both of your knees. Sway your legs to the right as if someone is kicking your knees from the left side. Keep your right knee forward, and let your left knee and hips tilt in the right direction. [1] X Research source When you sway your legs to the right, your left heel may lift off the ground. You can do the orange justice by lifting one heel off the ground, or lifting both heels off the ground.

steps.title: Shift your weight and sway your legs to the left.
steps.content: Shift your weight and sway your legs to the left. Once you sway your legs to the right, try doing it in the other direction. Keep your knees bent and imagine that someone is kicking your knees from the right side. As you shift your weight, keep your left knee forward and let your right knee and hips turn toward the left side. [2] X Research source When you shift your weight to the left, your right heel may naturally come off the ground. Feel free to keep one heel lifted, or lift both heels off the ground and carry your weight on your toes.

steps.title: Sway your legs from side to side.
steps.content: Sway your legs from side to side. If you can sway your legs to the left and to the right, the next step is to sway your legs from side to side in a seamless movement. Practice the leg movements for a few minutes, or until you feel comfortable rocking side to side. [3] X Research source Remember to sway side to side using your knees and hips, instead of moving your feet. If you feel awkward swaying from side to side, try doing the twist , or swinging your hips and knees in the same direction. This can warm up your body and help you dance more effortlessly. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Cross your arms down and in front of your body.
steps.content: Cross your arms down and in front of your body. Make an “X” shape with your arms by putting your right arm on top of your left. Flatten both of your palms and have them face your body. [5] X Research source It doesn’t matter which side you sway your hips to first when you add the arm movements!

steps.title: Put both of your arms down by your sides.
steps.content: Put both of your arms down by your sides. As you sway to the other side, straighten your arms, placing your left arm on the left side of your body and your right arm on your right side. Flatten your palms and have them facing your body, or fist both of your hands. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Open your arms into a relaxed shrug.
steps.content: Open your arms into a relaxed shrug. As you sway to the other side, stretch your arms up and to the side. Your arms should be in a relaxed shrug, or “I don’t know” gesture. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Straighten your arms by your sides.
steps.content: Straighten your arms by your sides. When you sway to the other side, keep your arms parallel, putting your right arm on your right side and your left arm on your left side. Position your palms so they face inward, or keep them in fists. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Clap up as you move to the other side.
steps.content: Clap up as you move to the other side. Raise your arms in front of your face and clap above your head. You should make a triangle with your arms with your head in the middle. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Combine the leg and hand movements.
steps.content: Combine the leg and hand movements. Once you’re confident with the leg and arm movements, try doing them at the same time! Start slowly, then speed things up when you get more comfortable. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Practice, practice, and practice.
steps.content: Practice, practice, and practice. Mastering the orange justice dance takes time and practice, so don’t give up if you can’t get it down right away. Stay positive and keep trying! Pull up an orange justice emote video on Youtube, and slow down the speed of the video so you can follow the exact movements.
